revised_title: Appreciation of Sir Harold Hartley's Contributions to the History of Science and the Royal Society
tldr: This article appreciates Sir Harold Hartley's work as the editor of Notes and Records, a journal focusing on the history of the Royal Society and its Fellows. It highlights his achievements in attracting authors, planning, editing, and using illustrations to make the journal interesting and attractive. Additionally, it discusses his contributions to the British National Committee of the History of Science, the Royal Society's library, and the preservation of historical scientific manuscripts.
